content.description:
This is a really good route that lies near the right edge of the Isis sector of the Screeching Wall. A technical start (stick clip recommended if you're at your limit) leads to fun face climbing up to the roof. Getting into the roof is really interesting and technical with some sporty clips. Finish up the headwall above on jugs to a tricky top out.

Past Isis, look for the big arching roof. Start in an alcove next to a pillar. When the routes split, head left.
8 bolts, rings.

Start up a short vertical section of the wall on good holds, followed by rambling up a easy section up to a left-trending ramp feature. Climb this with increasing difficulty and awkwardness to a flaring chimney. Crux near the top. Use a 70 metre rope.

Shares a start with Proudly Curving Upward, at the lowest portion of the wall. Mudman branches right after the fourth bolt.
12 bolts.

While Watching Bananas Bend gets all the hype on this wall, its neighbor is a stellar route in its own right.  
  
 Start up Bananas for two bolts, then go straight up, doing a hard move to gain the 4th bolt, then once at the ledge, take the left hand line of bolts that trend up and left. Above the ledge, you'll find flowing fun climbing with a bit of a stopper crux, followed by more fun. Worth a go if you're in the area and climbing the grade.

Next to Watching Bananas. Start up bananas, then head straight when Bananas heads right. Once on the ledge, take the left hand line of bolts.
12 bolts, chain anchors.

On the right side of the main wall is an amazing looking crack feature- this is your route. The purist in me says that this is probably very doable on gear, but the tourist in me says just enjoy it. Start below and a bit left of the crack and climb easily up the face and then traverse right into the crack and follow it for what seems like eternity to the top. A 70m rope is mandatory on this one- like most Skaha climbs, you'll want to save some gas for the top!

Right side of the Main Screeching Wall.
12 bolts, long draws are nice for the 2nd-4th bolts.

Start up the right facing corner/crack, and step right after the first bolt following turbo buckets to another right facing corner/flake. The run-out is between the first and second bolt, a fall would have you deck but the terrain is easy (5.6-ish). Pull hard on the flake to smear your feet against nothing on the wall, and then transition to a much more elegant style of climbing for the remainder of the climb. This line arcs slightly right to an anchor under the roof. Lot's of holds do not face up, and there is a bit of a nasty surprise right at the chains!

For a bonus letter, continue to the right after the chains and pull the roof to finish on the Scarab chains. 



Towards the right end of Screeching Wall there is a perfect little belay ledge just a couple feet above the underbrush. This starts off the left side of the belay ledge, look for the distinct flake with bolts just to its right. 

9 bolts, fixed anchor with biners

Gets better and better. Last 1m ups the route's grade from 10a to 10c, according to Howie Richardson.

Start as for Ascent of Mudman (10a sport), but fork left at the fourth bolt.
11 bolts

Just another phenomenal Skaha 12a...

Beautiful slab and face climbing leads to a cryptic but easy boulder. Sustained, beta-intensive and elegant movement brings you through the overhanging corner to the roof where the climb is effectively over...assuming that you're not to blasted and can still hold on to buckets. 

A couple of long draws help, extend the draws on either side of traversing bolt sequences. 



Towards the right side of Screeching Wall there is a small belay ledge. This starts right in the middle of the belay ledge, aiming for a bolt in the black/lichen covered rock just above a small roof. This bolt line arcs to the right into the high bulge/left facing overhanging corner system and pulls the roof at the top. 

12 bolts, fixed anchor with biners.

A nice long romp through dirty holds. 

Right facing dihedral that continues into a wide crack. This is on climbers right of Arch Evader and Evil Doer.
Single rack through bd 3, doubles .5 through 1.

Climb the dark grey dyke but don't let it suck you in. Enjoy the good holds and the pump. From John Wilder: "Watching Bananas Bend goes up the line of bolts for two bolts, then steps right on small holds with big feet, to another bolt. Follow this line up to a ledge, then step left and clip a bolt. Follow this line straight to the top of the wall. There is a connection to the route to the right part way up this route, so when given the choice, stay left to finish Bananas." From John Wilder: "Head up onto the ledge that is at the base of the Screeching Wall and move left- climbing up a bit to a two bolt belay at the base of a black/grey chunk of rock. The bolts are a bit left of a tree stump."

Watch yourself on the belay ledge and rapping. It's fine, just be careful. Bolts

This is the wall directly across from the Maternal Wall in the Maternal Group - home to many super long, technical routes, and morning sun. If you like 5.10-5.11 tech, this is your crag. There are even some harder slabby routes in the 5.12 range off to the right if that's your thing.
